criteria.name: Appropriateness
criteria.description: The methodology is well-suited to the specific problem context and requirements.

criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: The methodology is clearly articulated with well-defined processes and approaches.

criteria.name: Technical Soundness
criteria.description: The methodology is based on established best practices and technical principles.

criteria.name: Justification
criteria.description: The rationale for selecting this methodology is well-argued and convincing.

criteria.name: Adaptability
criteria.description: The methodology includes provisions for adapting to changing requirements or unforeseen challenges.

criteria.name: Comprehensiveness
criteria.description: The methodology addresses all key phases and aspects of the project without significant gaps.

criteria.name: Efficiency
criteria.description: The methodology promotes effective resource utilization and minimizes waste.

criteria.name: Internal Consistency
criteria.description: The components of the methodology work together harmoniously without contradictions.

criteria.name: Client Alignment
criteria.description: The methodology aligns with the client's organizational culture, capabilities, and preferences.

criteria.name: Measurability
criteria.description: The methodology includes clear metrics and checkpoints to assess progress and success.

evaluationInstructions: Evaluate the methodology against each criterion. For each criterion, provide a score between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely failing to meet the criterion and 1.0 is perfectly meeting it. Provide specific feedback for scores below the pass threshold.
